_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This Emergency Action Plan (EAP) was prepared by the City of Punta Gorda Utility Department staff for the City?s Water Treatment Plant.  The events of September 11, 2001 and the historically active 2004 hurricane season prompted the Utility Department to rewrite this EAP and include sections dealing with terrorism and an expanded weather related emergency narrative.

For security reasons, information about the location of the treatment plant or principal distribution components will be made in this document.  


1.1    Policy

It is the policy of the City of Punta Gorda to inform employees of the potential emergencies that could occur at the facility and to minimize potential impact to persons and property through an integrated Emergency Action Plan (EAP).  This plan consists of emergency recognition and prevention, preplanning, training, emergency preparedness, development of emergency and post emergency procedures, and EAP follow-up and review.  This EAP is available to all City of Punta Gorda Water Plant employees.


1.2    Scope

The Emergency Action Plan is intended to address potential hazards associated with fire / explosion, medical emergencies, storms and other natural disasters, power outages, acts of terrorism, and unplanned releases of hazardous chemicals that may occur at the facility.  This EAP meets the requirements of the following OSHA regulations:

?    29 CFR 1910.119(n) ? Emergency Planning and Response
?    29 CFR 1910.38  (a) ? Emergency Action Plan
?    FDEP Chapter 62-555.350(15) F.A.C.
?    Public Health and Bioterrorism Preparedness and Response Act of 2002

Appendix A provides a cross-reference of applicable portions of these regulations with appropriate sections of this EAP
1.3    Objective

The objective of the EAP is to eliminate or minimize personal injuries or property damage that could potentially be the consequence of an emergency situation.  

The EAP must properly handle the situation until City of Punta Gorda emergency authorities (Charlotte County O

ffice of Emergency Management, Fire Department, Ambulance, Police Department, etc.) can arrive to take over an emergency action.  After the arrival of such authorities, the EAP will advise them and assist them as requested or directed.

Although there are no absolute set of rules for handling every possible situation, the following plan of action is set forth as a guide to minimize potential loss and confusion in case an incident would happen to occur.

These procedures will be posted in all personnel departments, and reviewed annually by all applicable operations staff during monthly safety meetings.  

Suggestions or ideas for making the EAP procedures safer may be brought to the attention of the Plant Supervisor and the proper amendments may be made.


1.3    Mission and Goals

Mission Statement

In an emergency, the mission of the City of Punta Gorda water system is to protect the health of our customers and our community by being prepared to respond immediately to a variety of events that may result in contamination of the water distribution supply.

Goal 1

Be able to quickly identify an emergency and initiate timely and effective response actions.
Goal 2

Be able to quickly notify local, state, and federal agencies to assist in the response.


Goal 3

Protect public health by being able to quickly determine the water is not safe to drink or use and being able to rapidly notify customers effectively of the situation and advise them of appropriate protective action.

Goal 4

To be able to quickly respond to and repair damage to minimize or prevent system down time.
